alert.note: Alert for Pueblo (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 26 at 8:14PM MDT until July 26 at 10:45PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Colorado, including the following county, Pueblo. * WHEN...Until 215 AM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 811 PM MDT, Trained weather spotters reported water still over many roads up to 1 foot deep across southeast Pueblo West. Additionally, there are reports of stranded and submerged cars with streets closed due to high water on the northwest side of Pueblo near Platteville Boulevard. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northern Pueblo and Pueblo West. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
